message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.HC, cs.NE, cs.SD 

The paper proposes the use of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) for Human Activity Recognition (HAR) using raw data obtained from a set of inertial sensors. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper involves the study of human behavior and motion, which could also place it in the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) sub-category. The use of neural networks for classification also suggests that the paper could belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the analysis of experimental results, which could place it in the Scientific Computing (cs.SD) sub-category.
